title.text: A complete characterisation of local existence for semilinear heat equations in Lebesgue spaces
A complete characterisation of local existence for semilinear heat equations in Lebesgue spaces

abstract.text: We consider the semilinear heat equation u t − ∆u = f (u) with Dirichlet boundary conditions on a bounded domain Ω ⊂ R d . Under the assumption that f : [0, ∞) → [0, ∞) is continuous and non-decreasing we completely characterise those f for which the equation has a local solution bounded in L q (Ω) for all non-negative initial data u 0 ∈ L q (Ω). For q ∈ (1, ∞) this holds if and only if lim sup s→∞ s −(1+2q/d) f (s) < ∞; and for q = 1 if and only if ∞ 1 s −(1+2/d) F (s) ds < ∞, where F (s) = sup 1≤t≤s f (t)/t. The same results hold on the whole space R d provided that in addition lim sup s→0 f (s)/s < ∞.
